annotations.description: An example Django application with a PostgreSQL database. For more information about using this template, including OpenShift considerations, see https://github.com/sclorg/django-ex/blob/master/README.md.
annotations.openshift.io/long-description: This template defines resources needed to develop a Django based application, including a build configuration, application deployment configuration, and database deployment configuration.

template.message:
The following service(s) have been created in your project: ${NAME}, ${DATABASE_SERVICE_NAME}.

For more information about using this template, including OpenShift considerations, see https://github.com/sclorg/django-ex/blob/master/README.md.

annotations.description: Exposes and load balances the application pods
Keeps track of changes in the application image
Defines how to build the application
Defines how to deploy the application server
Defines how to deploy the database

parameters.name: NAME
parameters.description: The name assigned to all of the frontend objects defined in this template.

parameters.name: NAMESPACE
parameters.description: The OpenShift Namespace where the ImageStream resides.

parameters.name: PYTHON_VERSION
parameters.description: Version of Python image to be used (3.6-ubi8, 3.8-ubi8, 3.9-ubi8, or latest).

parameters.name: POSTGRESQL_VERSION
parameters.description: Version of PostgreSQL image to be used (10-el8, 12-el8, or latest).

parameters.name: MEMORY_LIMIT
parameters.description: Maximum amount of memory the Django container can use.

parameters.name: MEMORY_POSTGRESQL_LIMIT
parameters.description: Maximum amount of memory the PostgreSQL container can use.

parameters.name: VOLUME_CAPACITY
parameters.description: Volume space available for data, e.g. 512Mi, 2Gi

parameters.name: SOURCE_REPOSITORY_URL
parameters.description: The URL of the repository with your application source code.

parameters.name: SOURCE_REPOSITORY_REF
parameters.description: Set this to a branch name, tag or other ref of your repository if you are not using the default branch.

parameters.name: CONTEXT_DIR
parameters.description: Set this to the relative path to your project if it is not in the root of your repository.

parameters.name: APPLICATION_DOMAIN
parameters.description: The exposed hostname that will route to the Django service, if left blank a value will be defaulted.

parameters.name: GITHUB_WEBHOOK_SECRET
parameters.description: Github trigger secret.  A difficult to guess string encoded as part of the webhook URL.  Not encrypted.

parameters.name: DATABASE_ENGINE
parameters.description: Database engine: postgresql, mysql or sqlite (default).

parameters.name: APP_CONFIG
parameters.description: Relative path to Gunicorn configuration file (optional).

parameters.name: DJANGO_SECRET_KEY
parameters.description: Set this to a long random string.
